TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , co - agent , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant ’s former wife took proceedings against him in ORG , seeking the annulment of a donation of an amount of money made during their marriage . She claimed the return of CARDINAL convertible levs ( „ валутни лева “ ) , a special currency unit used in GPE at the time .

The first hearing was held on DATE . The applicant disputed the claim and counter - claimed for CARDINAL items of jewellery , allegedly costing MONEY ( “ BGL ” ) , which he had donated to his former wife . The court ordered an expert report on the value of the jewellery and requested from the applicant ’s and his former wife ’s bank all documents relating to the banking transactions effected during their marriage .

The second hearing took place on DATE . The court heard CARDINAL witnesses whose testimony related to the jewellery claimed by the applicant . Noting that the banking documents requested at the previous hearing had not been produced , the court reiterated its request to the bank .

The third hearing was held on DATE . The court admitted in evidence the expert report on the value of the jewellery . It noted that the banking information had not yet been produced and adjourned the case until DATE .

On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer asked the court to reschedule the hearing listed for CARDINAL DATE because he intended to be on leave CARDINAL and DATE . The court granted the request and listed a hearing for CARDINAL DATE .

At the hearing held on DATE the applicant ’s former wife increased her claim to CARDINAL convertible levs and returned part of the jewellery claimed by the applicant . The court ordered an additional expert report on the value of the jewellery .

The next hearing took place on DATE . The court heard CARDINAL witnesses and admitted in evidence the expert report on the value of the jewellery . The applicant ’s former wife ’s lawyer disputed the expert ’s conclusion and the court ordered a new expert report to be drawn up by CARDINAL experts .

The last hearing before ORG was held on DATE . The court admitted in evidence the report of the CARDINAL experts ordered at the previous hearing . The applicant ’s former wife presented certain documents as evidence . The court also heard the parties’ arguments .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG annulled the donation made by the applicant ’s former wife and ordered the applicant to pay the amount back . The court also disposed of the applicant ’s counter - claim , ordering his former wife to return certain items of jewellery .

On DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG . Having noted that he had not paid the requisite fee for filing an appeal , on DATE the court instructed him to rectify this omission . The applicant paid the fee and on CARDINAL DATE the court listed a hearing for DATE .

The hearing before ORG was held on DATE . The court refused the applicant ’s former wife ’s request to adjourn the hearing , admitted in evidence certain documents filed by the applicant and heard argument .

By judgment of DATE ORG partially vacated the first - instance judgment , holding that in view of the amount claimed by the applicant ’s former wife ( CARDINAL convertible levs , equal to BGL CARDINAL at the relevant time ) , the district court had lacked jurisdiction over the matter , the competent court for claims above BGL CARDINAL being the regional court . It upheld the judgment as regards the applicant ’s counter - claim in respect of the jewellery .
The proceedings then resumed at first instance before ORG , but only in respect of the initial claim of the applicant ’s former wife .

The first hearing before ORG was held on DATE . The applicant ’s former wife was represented by a new lawyer . The court ordered an accounting expert report to be prepared on the banking transactions of the applicant and his former wife .

The second hearing took place on DATE . The court admitted in evidence the accounting expert report . Finding that the report was not complete as the bank had not allowed the expert access to all relevant documents , the court ordered the expert to supplement the conclusions and ordered the bank to allow access to all documents . The court also heard CARDINAL witnesses .

The last hearing took place on DATE . The applicant ’s lawyer asked the court to adjourn the case , as ORG of which he was a member had ordered a strike and he could therefore not appear before the court on DATE . The court rejected the request , admitted the supplementary expert report in evidence and heard argument .
On DATE ORG decided in favour of the applicant ’s former wife .

On DATE the applicant appealed . Noting that the requisite court fee had not been paid , the court instructed the applicant to pay it . The applicant did so on DATE , and the case was forwarded to ORG .
A hearing due to take place before ORG on DATE was adjourned because the summons for the applicant ’s former wife had been served on her previous lawyer and not on her current lawyer .
The hearing was held on DATE . The applicant presented CARDINAL document as evidence and his written observations .

By judgment of DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment and remitted the case . It held that the lower court had erred by proceeding at its last hearing in the absence of the applicant ’s lawyer . It also held that the lower court ’s conclusion on the origin of part of the money claimed by the applicant ’s former wife had not been supported by the evidence and instructed that court to gather evidence in that respect . It also instructed the lower court to gather evidence about the applicant ’s former wife ’s animus donandi .

The first hearing in the proceedings on remittal before ORG was held on DATE . On the motion of the applicant ’s lawyer the court ordered an accounting expert report . It also invited the parties to present additional evidence .

The next hearing , which was due to take place on DATE , was adjourned because the expert report was not ready . Since a witness for the applicant ’s former wife was going to be out of the country for DATE , the court decided to schedule the next hearing for a date not earlier than DATE .
The hearing listed for DATE did not take place because the applicant ’s former wife , who was out of the country at that time , had not been correctly summoned .

A hearing was held on DATE . The court admitted in evidence the expert report ordered on DATE , and heard CARDINAL witnesses called by the applicant and CARDINAL witness for the applicant ’s former wife .

By judgment of DATE ORG found in favour of the applicant ’s former wife . It held that the amount in issue was the personal property of the applicant ’s former wife , that she had donated it to him during the marriage and that the applicant was obliged to return it .

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal . Finding that the applicant had specified the amount in convertible levs and not in NORP levs , as required under the relevant rules of civil procedure , on DATE the court instructed him to rectify this shortcoming . The applicant did so on DATE . Based on the amount specified by the applicant , the court calculated the requisite fee for filing an appeal , and on DATE invited the applicant to pay it . The applicant paid and on DATE the case file was forwarded to ORG .
The first hearing before ORG was due to take place on DATE , but was adjourned because the applicant ’s lawyer refused to accept the summons as he was no longer in contact with the applicant .
The hearing took place on DATE . The applicant was represented by a new lawyer . The court heard argument .

On DATE ORG , acting as a court of appeal , reversed the lower court ’s judgment as regards the additional amount claimed by the applicant ’s former wife and decided that her action was well - founded only in respect of the amount initially claimed .
On DATE the applicant ’s former wife ’s lawyer lodged a petition for review with a CARDINAL - member panel of ORG .

At a hearing held on DATE the court found that the petition for review , which had been lodged by a lawyer , was not accompanied by a power of attorney . It instructed the applicant ’s former wife ’s lawyer to rectify this omission . On CARDINAL DATE the court , noting that the omission had not been rectified after notification , discontinued the proceedings . As of that date its judgment of DATE became final .
